# iosxe_bridge_domain (Resource)

This resource can manage the Bridge Domain configuration.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "iosxe_bridge_domain" "example" {
  bridge_domain_id = 100
  member_vni       = 10100
  member_interfaces = [
    {
      interface = "GigabitEthernet2"
      service_instances = [
        {
          instance_id = 100
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `bridge_domain_id` (Number) <1..16000>;;bridge-domain ID
  - Range: `1`-`16000`

### Optional

- `delete_mode` (String) Configure behavior when deleting/destroying the resource. Either delete the entire object (YANG container) being managed, or only delete the individual resource attributes configured explicitly and leave everything else as-is. Default value is `all`.
  - Choices: `all`, `attributes`
- `device` (String) A device name from the provider configuration.
- `member_interfaces` (Attributes List) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--member_interfaces))
- `member_vni` (Number) - Range: `4096`-`16777215`

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The path of the object.

<a id="nestedatt--member_interfaces"></a>
### Nested Schema for `member_interfaces`

Required:

- `interface` (String)

Optional:

- `service_instances` (Attributes List) ethernet service instance (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--member_interfaces--service_instances))

<a id="nestedatt--member_interfaces--service_instances"></a>
### Nested Schema for `member_interfaces.service_instances`

Required:

- `instance_id` (Number) - Range: `1`-`8000`

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import iosxe_bridge_domain.example "<bridge_domain_id>"
```
